headline: Shrimp Egg Foo Young
description: This egg foo young recipe features golden egg patties with shrimp, bean sprouts, and green onions. Plus, a special sauce to spoon over the patties!
name: Shrimp Egg Foo Young

recipeInstructions.text: Mix bean sprouts, shrimp, eggs, green onions, and garlic powder together in a large bowl until well combined.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add about 1/2 cup of egg mixture into the skillet to make a patty. Repeat to add more patties to the skillet. Working in batches, fry patties until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, make the sauce: Whisk chicken broth, cornstarch, sugar, vinegar, and soy sauce together in a saucepan over medium-low heat; simmer until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I Made this recipe tonight it was easy to make and it turned out great! My husband and I both Loved it. I served it with rice and instead of shrimp I used roast pork it tasted like the egg foo young that I get at my neighborhood restaurant. I also made the sauce but will use a little less sugar. I will definitely be making this again and again , adding this to my favorite recipes. Linda M

The recipe was easy enough to follow but the egg patties lacked flavor. I am an experienced cook but the sauce never thickened up. I tried simmering it longer and also at slightly higher temperature. It also was very bland.

No bad intent to your recipe & never liked when others make bad comments or change the poster‚Äôs recipe. But gotta add my helpful remarks from my Chinese Grandpa‚Äôs recipe. You can add any veggies/celery broccoli/regular onions etc. You can add to the broth/Sherry/oyster sauce/tamari/soy sauce. Never heard of adding vinegar! And definitely more eggs. I use canola oil/but he used peanut. Over Jasmine rice‚Ä¶To die for üòã‚ù§Ô∏è
I only made the egg foo young. I love it because it wasn't time consuming to make. I didn't like them being flat. I didn't add or substitute anything

I‚Äôve been making seafood egg foo young for years, but hadn‚Äôt made it for a while so consulted your recipe. Basically great, but I substituted (as I always have) 4TBS dry sherry for the vinegar in the sauce, and duck sauce for soy, with a pinch of sea salt. I also add small shards of butter (hardened) to the egg mixture just before I flip it in the skillet.
Instead of frying in oil, I used my little Dash waffle iron and some cooking spray. They turned out great. ( The nooks and crannies helped hold that delicious sauce)
Made it and it turned out great. Served it with Jasmine rice it was almost like being at the restarraunt. Next time I'll do it with pork.

Everything about this. recipe works together for restaurant quality servings. I add sliced fresh mushrooms to the gravy and reduce the vinegar by at least half simply because I prefer it that way. It's a never fail family favorite!
This was nice and delicious.

I followed the recipe for the Egg Foo Young but not the sauce. With the reviews leaning towards making a brown gravy and adding some Soy Sauce that's what I did. I used canned bean sprouts because that's all our store carries. Next time I'll use some fresh cabbage mix. I scored this high because I think it's wrong to pick at a recipe when we make changes. Given fresh sprouts this would have been the five I scored it. Time to grow some!
Very quick and easy!!!

I know that taste is subjective but the egg foo young just didn't have the taste I was looking for. I'm from the Chicago area and it seemed like there was something missing. It needed salt. The gravy NEVER thickened. I even added more cornstarch in a slurry and that didn't help. It's in the fridge this morning and it's still thin and watery.

This was delicious but the gravy wasn‚Äôt as good. I believe the vinegar made it to tart so I will use less going forward. Also the corn starch needs to be disliked before adding or you will have chunks. Good recipe. I will make it again.

Made this for my dad's bday dinner tonight as it is his go to order for chinese take out. I used regular brown gravy instead of the gravy recipe listed here just because of the reviews/comments regarding the gravy recipe. I do want to say that I made the 4 serving recipe and it only fed 2 people. Luckily, I was only wanting to feed 2 people anyway.
Excellent recipe! I used another Allrecipes recipe (Easy Asian Dipping Sauce) with it. with excellent results!
It was excellent!!! And quite easy including the delicious gravy.
Followed the advice of others and halved the sugar and vinegar. Delicious!

I will just comment on the sauce, as the patty ingredients are pretty standard.

Distilled vinegar is much too acidic unless you let it boil off a bit. Better to use Xiaoxing wine, rice vinegar or in a pinch, apple cider vinegar. They all have a sweeter, mellow finish

I added oyster sauce for more umami flavor

Instead of chicken broth, I used broth made from shrimp heads and skins.

Great recipe. Cooked as written but would limit vinegar and sugar in gravy. Needs a more savory flavor to cover the delicious fresh sprouts, eggs, shrimp and onions. A treat to eat. Will make again and often.

I used 1 can (14.5oz) of chicken broth, not the 3 cups that the recipe called for....same amount of sugar, cornstarch, vinegar and soy sauce. Also added some very thinly sliced carrots. Liked how the veggies still remained crispy. Also, added 2 more eggs for a total of 6. Quite good!
I used rice wine vinegar instead of white and I used sesame oil as well. Gave more flavor!
I used 1/2 the vinegar and 2x the cornstarch
Super delicious!! Tasted like the local take out place I LOVE!!

I moved to Texas from California. Finding authentic Chinese food here is almost impossible. After eating at a few restaurants, I finally gave up and started cooking my own food. No, it‚Äôs not what I remember from home, but it is the next best thing!.
This is absolutely the best Egg Foo Young I have ever tasted anywhere . Thank you Karen for sharing.
the ingredient ratios seem very off. 2 cups of sauce is plenty rather than 3. the eggs could be increased or the bean sprouts decreased. i modified the sauce heavily to make it more palatable
Well...loved the egg part, did NOT like the sauce. Followed directions...but it didn't taste happy and it didn't thicken.
Pretty good, didn't make any changes.
I used shredded zucchini instead of bean sprouts
Easy to make and delicious.
I've made this dish several times now and I absolutely love it - I mean I crave it! It's so simple to make and my husband loves it as much as I do.
Loved it! Made smaller patties. Next time I will use asmaller pan 6" to8" and pour deeper product. WONDERFUL THANKS.

This is a good EASY recipe. It was very easy to follow. The only thing I would suggest is using some sort of tool to keep the egg in one place once it's in the skillet. Also I didn't really care for the gravy. I guess I was looking for the flavor that I get from the Chinese restaurants. But my children liked it so that's really all that matters on a weekday!
The egg foo young patty was delicious; the sauce was a bit off. I will make again and add chicken base; and omit the vinegar and sugar.
really liked it no changes made
I loved this. The batter is very loose so you have to pour it slowly into the pan but it works great! The gravy is fantastic also. Yum, I will make again soon.
The sauce was sweet and otherwise bland. It didn't thicken properly. Did not taste like any restaurant version I ever had.
I finally made it! it was easy, will try again time make it more like a patty.

Excellent recipe the Egg Foo young came out fantastic .
I made a double batch half with Spam and half with Kirkland's canned chicken.
 But do yourself a favor and get some gravy from a jar.
Make it again.

I just finished making and eating this dinner. I made the sauce first, to see if I liked it [I cut down on the vinegar as recommended]. I REALLY did not like the sauce. I made a package mix brown gravy instead. The egg foo young was fabulous! Very easy to make and very versatile too.
Love the recipe but I like it more when I use switch to sliced onions instead of green onions.
My sauce did not get as brown as the photos and I followed the direction exactly. the omelets were perfect.
Easy to make
I agree with some other reviewers that the sauce wasn‚Äôt that great, but an easy recipe to learn how to make at home.

I followed this recipe carefully since I‚Äôve had problems with sauce on previous attempts. Another disappointment. The sauce lacked flavor in so many ways. I added salt, sesame oil, sriracha...still missing component to make it appealing. The egg patties were fine . Overall, healthy and edible, just a bit boring.
I used another packaged gravy because I was hungry, and it was still good. Simple and good. Some recommended an additional egg and I wished I had done that...but I will in the future.

I made the recipe for the Egg Foo Yung for the first time, my husband and I both loved it. Reading the reviews, I see a lot of good ideas to perfect the recipe to make it more to my liking. Need to purchase the mini egg skillet also going to omit vinegar and add sesame oil, did add extra cornstarch to thicken.
Less Vinegar and, Sugar a dab of sesame oil and, fish oil in the gravy form past experience. Seasoned Shrimp. Added Green Onions. Trader Joe's Chicken and Rice. Humm Hummm GOOD!!

I love egg foo yung. It's so flexible. You can use ground pork, shrimp, baked tofu, or no meat at all. You can use sauteed bell pepper, sauteed mushrooms, leftover coleslaw mix, broccoli slaw, zucchini, carrots, or any other veggies. It's even good with a bit of chopped celery, bok choy, or chopped regular cabbage. 

You can also use beef broth in the gravy. I highly recommend getting a bottle of oyster sauce, or vegan oyster sauce (made of mushroom.) Put a couple of TBSP in the egg mix and a couple of TBSP. in the gravy. That is the secret to tasting like restaurant quality. I REALLY like your addition of sugar here. I have not done that before, and it made a huge difference. 

This is such a great recipe. It's such a nice place to start.
What a great recipe. I doubled the batch and ir worked out well. I like it better than my Asian cuisine here.

Four eggs is too much. I would suggest 3 even 2. Using a pan to contain the patties, otherwise they run all over a large pan.
The Sauce is way too much. I made half the recipe and still have a lifetime supply!
Tasty. I used spiralized zucchini because that is what I had.
The sauce didn't thicken.
Very tasty, I think next time instead of cornstarch I will try some rice flour. And maybe even some mung bean or po noodle noodles rather than bean sprouts. But very yummy

Easy to make. I added mushrooms and a small amount of celery chopped very fine. Didn't notice that the shrimp were supposed to be cooked until too far into recipe. I chopped the shrimp "bite size" and they cooked as the eggs did and it worked out great!

I‚Äôve made this a few times now. It keeps getting better with practice. I followed another reviewer‚Äôs suggestion and did half the amount of vinegar and half the amount of sugar. I also added extra corn starch. I usually make this with no meat so I do add extra green onion and extra?? bean sprouts. I also had just a dash of salt as well as a little onion powder to my egg mixture. Delicious!?
I did make it..but i like my receipe better..i add a teaspoon n half of oyster sauce..n i didnt care for the vinegar in the recipe
I could only find canned bean sprouts. I am sure it would be great with fresh. Would make it again

This was the second time I made this. The first time was perfect. The second time I didn‚Äôt have bean sprouts. Don‚Äôt forget the bean sprouts! It was still very good and so easy to make but it was missing some texture.

I cook alot and am always trying recipe's from here and this one nailed it. I've used chicken and the cheapest cuts or (none of it cheap)beef and they melted I your mouth. Anyone who has tough cuts of meat should try this. Oh my egg foo young was spectacular and I used the beef for Chile and street tacos. Believe me just Do It

This turned out just like what I get at the restaurant. I did follow the suggestions some made to reduce the vinegar and sugar in half for the sauce. I also added 1/4 tsp of Sesame Seed Oil for the added orient flavor. This was great. My husband is looking forward to the next time I make it. Lady D
The gravy is a little salty for our taste but the dish itself is very good!
This was a great change from our traditional ham for Christmas. Everyone how ate it liked it. I will be using this recipe quite often in the future.

Excellent! I used finely diced cooked pork roast that I marinated in soy, brown sugar and oyster sauce before frying off to caramelize. I did a quick saut√©e of all veggies before I assembly lined dinner for 8. I did a few with and without meat. Added cilantro for those who favor the taste. My go to foo yung sauce has always been 3 C stock, 3 T Oyster Sauce, 1 T Pad Thai paste, 1 tsp Thai Garlic Chili paste. Simmer for 20 minutes. Thicken with a corn starch slurry. I‚Äôve added some garlic powder when the mood struck, but the base sauce hits the flavor notes, I think compliment the egg foo yung best. A relatively light and yummy alternative to omelets. Just as messy and I honestly prefer these! Thank you for reminding me how much I prefer them!
Delicious
This recipe is as good as any restaurant. I use chicken, shrimp, and pork as the protein filler. Sometimes I add shredded ginger too. Delicious!

I've made this 40 some years ago for my young family and we alwAys loved it, LaChoy use to have it in a pkg and all I had do was add eggs and chicken or me√†t or seafood of choice. And added water to package of powdered sauce. Little more time consuming this way but very good. I had to add more sugar and soy sauce and just a tad of vinegar. Turned out great. I also love the leftovers.

The Chinese restaurant across the street from my house is still better. I made the recipe exactly as written. The patties, for me, were a little bland and a little thin. I'd probably hit it with a lot more garlic, some soy sauce, and maybe even some 5 spice powder. I'm also thinking the egg mixture itself might use some corn starch. Unlike most people, I thought the sauce had real potential. It was more thin than I'd like, so I'd increase the cornstarch. I'd probably use beef stock rather than chicken. I'd also increase the soy sauce by quite a bit; probably 2 more TBS.

We made this for breakfast this morning after we purchased 8 lbs. of bean sprouts and were looking for ways to use it. This recipe was delicious. We did take some of the advice that was given by one reviewer to only use 1 tablespoon of sugar and 1 tablespoon of vinegar rather than the amount proposed in recipe. Everything about this recipe was yummy and it was super easy to make. Also with the gravy, yes double the cornstarch. Will be making this again soon. Like tomorrow.

We made this for breakfast this morning after we purchased 8 lbs. of bean sprouts and were looking for ways to use it. This recipe was delicious. We did take some of the advice that was given by one reviewer to only use 1 tablespoon of sugar and 1 tablespoon of vinegar rather than the amount proposed in recipe. Everything about this recipe was yummy and it was super easy to make. Also with the gravy, yes double the cornstarch. Will be making this again soon. Like tomorrow.
The patty was excellent, I added shrimp and bean sprouts along with green onion and yellow onions. I would definitely make this again and again.
The gravy was a little greasy for my taste but the patties were amazing. I'm eliminating the oil next time. Family enjoyed it.

I have been wanting to try this recipe for a month. My girl is out on a girls night with her friends, so I was left to my own devices. I followed the recipe to the letter. It turned out awesome. It reminds me of my moms Chinese food nights. Everything was great. Next time I make it I got to make the sauce thicker. I remember it really thick.
**Fantastic**. Bravo !!! I made one change added minced mushrooms. Family loved it. This is a new staple...

This was so delicious. When my son and I had it the other night 
he said it was delicious, and it smelled like we were in a Chinese Resturant. So delicious we are having it again tonight.
very good . I will make it again.

I was very impressed with this recipe. I used 5 eggs, 3/4 lb. shrimp and due to reviews on the sauce, I substituted McCormick Brown Gravy and it worked out great. The only problem I had was getting the patties brown enough and to stay together despite a long cook, but that was no big deal. Still tasted very good.

We really enjoyed the egg foo young but the sauce wasn't to our taste. I like to bite into a good size chunk of shrimp so I used size 8-13 that I cut into thirds so they would cook properly, I used raw. I also added about a cup of roughly chopped mushrooms. I'm not sure why the garlic was included as it doesn't come through. This recipe yielded 4 good size patties that I cooked for 3 minutes per side.

Unfortunately this recipe had no taste. I modified it by adding an additional 1/2 of the 1/4 tsp of garlic powder when whipping up the eggs, bean sprouts, onions. I cooked the recipe according to directions but the shrimp egg foo young patties still did not have any taste. I added additional seasoning to the gravy (soy sauce) hoping this would rescue the taste before serving. I even omitted the vinegar since someone else who made it said the vinegar ruined the gravy for the patties. I'm not sure what additional seasoning is needed to bring this recipe up to snuff. If anyone has anyone suggestions I would appreciate the help since we love shrimp egg foo young! Thanks.

I used bok choy choy instead of bean sprouts because the sprouts have been hard to find since the ecoli scare years ago. Cut them thin and use just the same. Added peas. And used a stir-fry sauce with soy and fish sauce and cornstarch instead of the sauce recipe here.
Patties were excellent, but sauce was disapointingly bland...

Very easy and quick to make. Truly tasted like I could have purchased it from a Chinese store. Never will buy again now I can make. It made 4 nice size patties, I used jasmine rice and the gravy was awesome. Thanks!
Great recipe! Easy to make & tasty too. I made my own gravy out of some flour & oil from the egg foo young. Turned out great. Can't wait to make it again. ??

It would be a 5 but you need to use another recipe for the gravy... everything else is great and just like we have at a restaurant.. This is one of my favorite things to have out but we have to have gluten free soy sauce so we need to make at home

The patties are excellent and easy. That sauce is not good.... I tried it with the recommendations and even then I didn't enjoy it. I will keep the patty recipe but next time I will add mushrooms and grilled onions. The sauce needs some reworking. The way I tried it (but still didn't like-- it was too tangy and not savory) was double the cornstarch, a tblsp of sesame oil and half the sugar and distilled white vinegar and 2 tblsp soysauce

I used this recipe as a starting point and tweaked it as follows: used diced left-over ham, a well drained can of Chinese style veggies, and a jar of chicken gravy with some soy sauce mixed in. Delicious and easy. The whole family enjoyed them.

We put less than half the sugar and halved the vinegar from some of the other suggestions made.
It was so good, took me back to my childhood.
For some reason Egg foo young isn't offered in Chinese restaurants around here.
Thanks everyone for all the feedback

vege no fish or meat
wonderful
This was easy and a nice change to have. They gravy was a bit too vinegary for my taste. But much better the next day. Making this for a friends birthday.

Made this for the first time tonight. It was easy and very delicious. The only thing I had to do was add like 3 more tablespoons of cornstarch to the gravy to get it to thicken up. But, it was outstanding.
I used white pepper with the garlic powder
I made the recipe as is, but I decided to get a packaged brown gravy in case we didn't like the sauce. Glad I did because the sauce recipe wasn't good.
Love it and it is soooo easy. I have made it several times and used a different mix of veggies and meat each time.

The patties themselves are excellent! But the sauce is awful! I was resorting to anything I could to fix it, adding beef broth, adding bouillon. Couldn't save it!! I think it's the vinegar. I'll try to find another sauce recipe and use this one for the patties.
This is a fabulous recipe. I often use ham or spam instead of shrimp. Delicious

Loved this. For the sauce I deglazed the skillet with a little beer and had the cornstarch mixture ready of chili sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, soy sauce and fish sauce. It came out great since I don't use chicken broth.
Husband loved it. Wanted to box it up in the Chinese boxes and sell it :-)

This is incredible! I couldn't believe how exactly the same as the restaurant it tasted! I made as written minus the bean sprouts because the store didn't have any, and added frozen peas and medium frozen thawed shrimp cut into bite sized peices. I didn't make the sauce cuz I like the traditional brown gravy. For that I used 2 C chicken broth and 2 T of soy sauce and mixed in cornstarch slurry. Served over white rice. Scrumptious!

I have loved shrimp egg foo young for years and never thought I could make it myself. Thanks to this recipe I will perfect it with time. Like most reviews,the sauce was the stumbling block. But the egg came out great! I look forward to future attempts.
Easy to make, however, the sauce was a tad bit off. It was on the sweeter side.

This is very yummy and healthy. It is wonderful as is. I thank you so mush for sharing this. My mom used to make them out of a box when I was a kid, but they discontinued it. I use recipes as a guide and switch things sometimes to the things I have on hand. I use whatever left over meat I have or leave it out. I have also used caned Chinese vegetables and a can of beansprouts. I have also added onion and celery. I always cook the vegetables first and then add to the egg and fry. The sauce is what makes these. Don't let the vinegar scare you. I used powdered chicken broth the low sodium one to cut down on sodium. I made it tonight and my Dad said it was the best meal he has had all week.
